awd_titl_txt: Theory of Solvation and Chemical Reaction Dynamics in       Polar Media
awd_abstract_narration: Professor Branka Ladanyi is supported by a grant from the                       Theoretical and Computational Chemistry Program to perform                      theoretical studies of solvent effects on chemical reactions.                   This research will help to provide a deeper theoretical                         understanding of the factors which influence and enhance                        chemical reactions in solution.                                                                                                                                 Professor Ladanyi plans to use a combination of integral                        equation approaches and computer simulations to study solvent                   effects on the rates of chemical reactions.  The work will                      focus on three specific topics: 1) solvent effects on the                       activation barrier for torsional isomerization; 2) solvent                      effects on the transition state for bimolecular reactions of                    ions and/or polar molecules in polar solvent mixtures; and 3)                   dynamic solvation, i.e., the transient response of the solvent                  to a charge transfer electronic transition of a probe molecule.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
